metadata.dc:author: Henríquez Alarcón, M
Camacho Arrioaga, J J
Altuna Mariezkurrena, X
Algaba Guimerá, J
Goiburu Mínguez, M
Vea Orté, J C
metadata.dc:description: The recurrent respiratory papillomatosis is a benign lesion induced by virus, with predisposal factors not yet clear out. Several treatment have been used, being the endoscopic surgery with laser CO2 the most used technique. We present our experience with laryngeal papillomatosis patients operated with laser CO2 in the last 15 years. The high rate of recidive in the youth pattern and the possibility of malignant degeneration in the adults charactherises this patients. Meanwhile without not other concluyent works surgery will be the first therapeutic alternative, avoiding mutilant operations, and paying attention in detecting lesions suggesting malignancy.
metadata.dc:title: Papilomatosis respiratoria recurrente. Nuestra experiencia y revisión de la literatura.
[Recurrent respiratory papillomatosis. Our experience and literature review].
